title: Vardy received death threats after Ranieri's Leicester City exit
text:
Vardy received death threats after Ranieri's Leicester City exit Getty Images 0 21-Mar-2017 04:28:31 The forward dismissed the stories alleging Foxes players were behind the manager's sacking and admitted supporters had reacted violently 
Jamie Vardy has revealed he has received death threats from fans irate at Leicester City's dismissal of club hero Claudio Ranieri. 
The Italian delivered Leicester's first-ever title in an incredible Premier League campaign in 2015-16, but was sacked when results this season took a nosedive. 
But Vardy insists that, despite rumours to the contrary, he and other senior Foxes players had nothing to do with the decision. 
'Bravo & Caballero not as good as Hart' 
"The stories were quite hurtful to be honest with you," Vardy said to reporters, in reference to a reported meeting with the club owner that sealed Ranieri's fate. 
"A lot of false accusations were being thrown out there and there's nothing us, as players, could do about it. 
"As soon as they were in the papers they were out there. We just had to put it to the back of our minds and concentrate on the football. 
"I read one story that said it was straight after the Seville game. It said I was personally involved in a meeting when I was actually sat in anti-doping for three hours. A few of you [reporters] waited around for an interview after." 
The striker added that he and wife Rebekah had been subjected to abuse in the streets and even received threats against their lives. 
"Then, of course, the story is out there and people pick it up and jump on it and you're getting death threats - about your family, kids, everything, on social media, you name it, walking down the street," he said. 
"To be honest, I get them every week. Football fans don't seem to like me that much. I get abuse at every stadium that I turn up at. To be honest, you are always going to get stick from fans. It is part and parcel of football. 
"I just get on with it, but when people are trying to cut your missus [wife] up while she's driving along, with the kids in the back of the car, it's not the best. It is terrifying. People get cut up, but if there are no cameras, you're screwed." Related
